mn123:22.2.pli: Idhānanda, tathāgatassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
mn123:22.2.en: It’s that the Realized One knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

mn123:22.3.en: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

mn123:22.4.pli: viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
mn123:22.4.en: He knows thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

mn123:23.1.pli: “Yampi, bhante, bhagavato viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
mn123:23.1.en: “Sir, the Buddha knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

mn123:23.2.en: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

mn123:23.3.pli: viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
mn123:23.3.en: He knows thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an7.38:1.6.pli: tassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
an7.38:1.6.en: They know feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an7.38:1.7.pli: viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
an7.38:1.7.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an7.38:1.8.pli: viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
an7.38:1.8.en: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

sn47.35:3.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
sn47.35:3.2.en: It’s when a mendicant knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

sn47.35:3.3.pli: Viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
sn47.35:3.3.en: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

sn47.35:3.4.pli: Viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
sn47.35:3.4.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, nandassa viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
an8.9:5.2.en: Nanda knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.3.en: He knows perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an8.9:5.4.en: He knows thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

dn33:1.11.39.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
dn33:1.11.39.en: A mendicant knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

dn33:1.11.40.pli: Viditā saññā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
dn33:1.11.40.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

dn33:1.11.41.pli: Viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
dn33:1.11.41.en: They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an4.41:4.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viditā vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti;
an4.41:4.2.en: It’s when a mendicant knows feelings as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.

an4.41:4.3.pli: viditā saññā …pe… viditā vitakkā uppajjanti, viditā upaṭṭhahanti, viditā abbhatthaṁ gacchanti.
an4.41:4.3.en: They know perceptions as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away. They know thoughts as they arise, as they remain, and as they go away.
